Tips to fall asleep fast :
1, Get rid of your thoughts, all of them : Imagine clouds and label them each as one of your thought, if they are too many you will have a tough time trying to fall asleep. We have two places that store memories; short term memory and long term memory. When something happens the information goes into your short term memory and your brain figures out whether or not it's important. If it is it goes into your long term memory, if not it is forgotten. With deja vu a piece of information goes straight into your long term memory instead of your short term memory. This gives you the feeling that you've known the information for a long time and have experienced it before.

I think anything more than 30 minutes, but not long enough to enter the deep sleep stages. Interrupting the deep sleep stage will make you feel even more tired, so it's good to nap between the light sleep stage. You can do some experimenting with yourself. When you feel tired, try it. Set your alarm for 30 minutes of sleep. Wake up, test how you feel. Then do 10 minute intervals, until you feel tired after a nap. Anytime before that and between 30 minutes or so is good !

Your brain does not " Wake up and dream ". The light stages of sleeping are when the brain is organizing and placing memories from the moment before you slept, together. If one does not sleep after a day full  of learning, but sleeps the next day, they are less likely to remember things from the learning day. The brain never sleeps. It organizes thoughts while still taking them in. So yes, technically, you do sleep to "re-charge" your brain in a way.
